intro: Petrocosmea iodioides, commonly known as the iodine orchid, is a rare and unique species native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan, China. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with a distinctive yellow-green lip. The plant thrives in rocky, high-altitude environments, often growing on cliffs or among boulders. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Petrocosmea iodioides is considered an endangered species.
